short_summary: The tender seeks User Experience (UX) Professional Services on an as-and-when needed basis to support the Chief Digital Officer Sector (CDOS) digital transformation to user-centered products and services.
description: This tender is for UX services, including research, analysis, design, and testing to ensure compliance with accessibility standards (...)
full_summary:
## Title
Digital Transformation User Experience (UX) Services

## Call for Proposal
A Request for Proposal (RFP) has been issued by Fisheries and Oceans Canada (DFO) for the provision of User Experience (UX) Professional Services.

## Background
DFO aims to transform its digital services to be more user-centered, accessible, and efficient, involving multiple stakeholder groups. The selection process will focus on delivering a high-quality, user-centered experience through a combination of methods, including urban planning, infrastructure systems design, networks design, and human-centered design.

## Objective
The objective is to design and deliver programs and services that are accessible to all, including people living with disabilities. The successful bidder will provide UX services to support DFO's digital transformation and meet user needs through research, analysis, design, and testing.

## Work to be Performed
The successful bidder will provide UX services including:

* Designing products, systems, and services with a focus on user needs and accessibility
* Identifying areas for improvement and recommending solutions to deliver value to stakeholders
* Informing design processes through user research and feedback
* Creating user-centered, efficient, and effective services
* Managing and improving product quality

## Requirements
The successful bidder must:

* Provide services on an as-and-when basis
* Comply with DFO's security requirements and obtain the necessary certifications
* Provide minimum corporate security designated organization screening (DOS) and minimum resource security reliability status

## Submissions and Evaluation Criteria
Submissions must include a comprehensive proposal outlining the bidder's approach, methodology, and qualifications. The evaluation criteria will focus on:
* Ability to meet the objectives of the RFP
* Quality of the proposed solution
* Partnerships and collaboration with stakeholder groups
* Experience in delivering similar projects and services
* Provide evidence of compliance with DFO's security requirements

## Tender Closing Date and Time
December 09, 2024, at 14:00 hours (EST)
 
Please refer to Annex “A” – Statement of Work for full details on this RFP.

Contact Information: Charles Nwachukwu (Charles.nwachukwu@dfo-mpo.gc.ca) or (902) 478-9713 for further clarification. 
You are to respond to the call for proposal by December 09, 2024 for this RFP. The supplier will be awarded based on the evaluation result described above.
